creator: steve.lee@cramer.com
text:
I copy a WAR file into the webapps directory and add a context entry to the 
server.xml.

<Context cookies="false" debug="0" docBase="webapp" path="/app/webapp" 
reloadable="false"/>

The WAR is unpacked and deployed to app/webapp.

Is this correct behaviour?

Surely the context path is independent of the physical path structure which 
specified by docbase/context root.

This was the case in Tomcat 4.
creator: steve.lee@cramer.com

text:
The deployer is quite dumb, so this is a limitation. If you want to have more
freedom, you should put your context root (unpacked) outside of the host
appBase. If you point to a WAR, then it will unpack to the host appBase, which
is the right thing to do for now.
creator: remm@apache.org
